description:
There seems to be some situation that prevents nova-api from shutting down cleanly. One process can be left behind, preventing restarts. Unfortunately I don't have much detailed information, but here goes what I know:

nova-api.log reported the service shutting down without any exceptions. Last request was handled correctly, then the standard shutdown sequence follows:

2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, stopping children
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Waiting on 21 children to exit
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.service [-] Caught SIGTERM, exiting
2012-09-19 20:27:34 INFO nova.wsgi [-] Stopping WSGI server.

Main process reports waiting for 21 children and it looks like the count is correct for SIGTERM messages:

$ tail -n 50 /var/log/nova/nova-api.log.1 | grep SIGTERM | wc -l
22

Not sure about the 'Stopping WSGI server' messages though:

$ tail -n 50 /var/log/nova/nova-api.log.1 | grep 'Stopping WSGI server' | wc -l
12

There is still one process left, but it doesn't seem to be the main one. Upstart reported the following in syslog:

Sep 19 20:27:34 nv-aw1rde1-schedule0000 kernel: [4316283.745184] init: nova-api main process (5832) terminated with status 143

so it seems like it's a child process that stays around, because the pid is different from the one reported:

$ pgrep nova-api
1535

Process itself seems to only sleep in 1min intervals, with no sockets to monitor, if you attach strace to it:

$ sudo strace -p 1535
Process 1535 attached - interrupt to quit
select(0, NULL, NULL, NULL, {22, 691264}) = 0 (Timeout)
select(0, NULL, NULL, NULL, {60, 0}

I don't have any more information - is there something else that I could check?
title: nova-api not shutting down cleanly under some conditions

comments.content:
Can you clarify what version of nova you are running?

Also, do you have the *_workers options set in nova.conf (like osapi_compute_workers) ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
I'm running the upstream-built 2012.2+git201209072153~precise-0ubuntu1 package - not sure which git hash does it correspond to unfortunately.

Workers are set to:

ec2_workers=10
osapi_compute_workers=10
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stanislaw-pitucha

comments.content: One more question: how reproducible is this?  Does it happen to you every time you try to shut it down?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
No, it happened only once, but then again I was running that release only for around 4 days without a manual restart.

If you just want to close it as not reproducible, that's ok, but any ideas for additional debugging if it happens again would be appreciated.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stanislaw-pitucha

comments.content:
I think what would be most valuable is a way to reproduce it at all.  I can't make it happen on devstack, so it may be specific to using upstart.

I'll leave this bug open, but marked as "Incomplete" for now, pending the ability to reproduce it.  If you can make it happen again, please leave a comment with what it took for you to reproduce it and then we can dig into it more.

Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
Just happened to me too, I will be uploading my configs and logs. How to fix it? Reboot?

I'm using the Cloud Archive packages on ubuntu 12.04, and using a single node setup running all services. This didn't happen to me before.

I've attached a bunch of logs, hope it may be useful:

comments.content: Seems the nova-api package got uninstalled when I was removing quantum related packages... so in my case it was just missing the nova-api binary. Guess the bug happened before, but in the end the real cause was a missing nova-api package.
